page.title: 20SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY
page.content: Rufford Colliery uses computers for control schemes and environmental monitoring.For maximum efficiency and safety,transducers are fitted to conveyors to monitor conditions which are displayed on a V.D.U.If a fault is located,the operator can take early action so that coal production is disturbed as little as possible.Trans- ducers analyse gases,the signals being transmitted via data lines to surface computers.The computers handle control of fans,pumps and methane extraction plant underground.The computers and software are made to the colliery's specification.The system runs with a master and slave set up so that any computer can run the whole scheme if necessary.Access to information and control is obtained by the control room operator keying in requirements.
